boot_files: Where to find imager.img and its kernel file
boot_mode: PXE boot mode is a setting that affects systemimager-server-netbootmond. If set to LOCAL, then after successful completion of an install, a client's net boot configuration is modified to ensure future boots will happen from the client's local disk. NET_BOOT_DEFAULT can be set to local or net. Be sure to restart systemimager-server-netbootmond after changing this setting (/etc/init.d/systemimager-server-netbootmond restart).

clients_db_dir: Where to save imaged clients informations and installation logs.
log_file: Monitor logfile absolute path. Defaults to /var/log/systemimager/si_monitord.log
log_level: Monitor loglevel. Range from 0 (no log) to 5 (full debug: extremely verbose). Defaults to 1

overrides_dir: Place where override files are stored. They are copied to client filesystem overwriting existing files.
scripts_dir:
Place holding imaging scripts and various client configurations:
  • pre-install/ all optional pre-install scripts
  • main-install/ The optional main install script
  • post-install/ all optional post-install scripts
  • configs/ clients configuration files
  • disks-layouts/ clients disks layout files
  • network-configs/ clients optional network configuration files
  • cluster.txt The cluster/client groups definition file (see si_clusterconfig)
getimage_excludes: List of paths and files to ignore when retreiving an image from a golden client

stubs_dir: The path to the directory where SystemImager rsync stub files are stored
log_file: The log file specific to SystemImager rsync daemon

directory_port_base: SystemImager's flamethrower port base. Defaults is 9000
net_iface: SystemImager's flamethrower network interface name. Defaults to eth0
